You said:
use only tailwind css
ChatGPT said:

To create a carousel using only Tailwind CSS without any external libraries, you can achieve this by using CSS scroll snapping. Here's how you can implement it:

javascript
import React from "react";

function OurHiringPartners() {
  const OurClients = [
    { src: "client1.svg" },
    { src: "client2.svg" },
    { src: "client3.svg" },
    { src: "client4.svg" },
    { src: "client5.svg" },
    { src: "client6.svg" },
    { src: "client7.svg" },
    { src: "client8.svg" },
  ];

  return (
    <div className="bg-[#F8F8F8]">
      <div className="container lp:max-w-full tb:max-w-full lp:px-10 flex flex-col mx-auto sm:max-w-full sm:px-0">
        <div className="w-full flex flex-col items-center gap-5 p-4">
          <h1 className="text-enroll_users font-semibold text-4xl tb:text-center sm:text-center sm:text-3xl">
            Our Hiring Partners
          </h1>
          <p className="text-learnsmarter_text_p text-center font-medium text-sm w-[360px]">
            Top Placement Support and Training Institute in Chennai Our
            Recruitment Partners
          </p>
        </div>

        {/* Carousel Container */}
        <div className="overflow-x-auto pb-4">
          <div className="flex gap-4 items-center w-max snap-x snap-mandatory">
            {OurClients.map((client, index) => (
              <div
                key={index}
                className="flex-shrink-0 snap-center flex justify-center w-40 h-40 p-4 bg-white rounded-lg shadow-md"
              >
                <img src={client.src} alt={`Client ${index + 1}`} />
              </div>
            ))}
          </div>
        </div>
      </div>
    </div>
  );
}

export default OurHiringPartners;

Explanation:

  1. Container Styles:

    • overflow-x-auto: Enables horizontal scrolling.
    • pb-4: Adds padding at the bottom to make scrolling smoother.

  2. Carousel Items:

    • flex-shrink-0: Ensures the items don't shrink when scrolling.
    • snap-center: Aligns each item in the center when it snaps.
    • w-40 h-40: Sets the width and height of each carousel item.

  3. Scroll Snapping:

    • snap-x: Enables horizontal scroll snapping.
    • snap-mandatory: Forces the scroll to snap to the nearest item.

This approach uses Tailwind's utility classes and CSS scroll snapping to create a lightweight carousel without additional libraries.

You can create a horizontally scrolling text animation using the method you've provided, translated into Tailwind CSS. Heres how you can do it:

HTML & Tailwind CSS

html
<div class="overflow-hidden whitespace-nowrap w-full box-border relative flex items-center bg-[#F4F4F4]">
  <div class="flex whitespace-nowrap animate-scroll-left">
    <span class="text-[#143AA0] text-sm font-semibold px-4">Text 1</span>
    <span class="text-[#5D7286] text-sm font-semibold px-4">Text 2</span>
    <span class="text-[#143AA0] text-sm font-semibold px-4">Text 3</span>

Custom Tailwind CSS for Animation

To implement the scrolling animation using Tailwind CSS, you'll need to extend the configuration to include the custom animation:

javascript
// tailwind.config.js
module.exports = {
  theme: {
    extend: {
      keyframes: {
        'scroll-left': {
          '0%': { transform: 'translateX(0%)' },
          '100%': { transform: 'translateX(-50%)' },
        },
      },
      animation: {
        'scroll-left': 'scroll-left linear infinite',
      },
    },
  },
  plugins: [],
}

Explanation:

  1. Container (div with overflow-hidden):

    • overflow-hidden ensures that any overflowing content (like the scrolling text) is hidden outside the bounds of the container.
    • whitespace-nowrap prevents the text from wrapping onto multiple lines.
    • relative, flex, items-center positions the text in the center.

  2. Scrolling Text (div with animate-scroll-left):

    • animate-scroll-left applies the custom animation defined in your Tailwind configuration.
    • flex, whitespace-nowrap ensures the text is displayed in a single line and scrolls horizontally.

  3. Text Span (span with text colors and padding):

    • px-4 adds padding between each text item.
    • The text colors and font sizes are applied as per your provided styles.

This setup allows you to have a smooth scrolling text effect, similar to a news ticker, using Tailwind CSS with a custom animation.

ChatGPT said:

To implement a minimal CSS-based carousel for the OurHiringPartners component, you can apply the scrolling effect with Tailwind CSS and a simple keyframe animation. Here's how you can modify your code:

Updated OurHiringPartners Component

javascript
import React from "react";

function OurHiringPartners() {
  const OurClients = [
    { src: "client1.svg" },
    { src: "client2.svg" },
    { src: "client3.svg" },
    { src: "client4.svg" },
    { src: "client5.svg" },
    { src: "client6.svg" },
    { src: "client7.svg" },
    { src: "client8.svg" },
  ];

  return (
    <div className="bg-[#F8F8F8] py-8">
      <div className="container mx-auto flex flex-col items-center">
        <h1 className="text-enroll_users font-semibold text-4xl sm:text-3xl text-center">
          Our Hiring Partners
        </h1>
        <p className="text-learnsmarter_text_p text-center font-medium text-sm w-[360px] mt-4">
          Top Placement Support and Training Institute in Chennai Our
          Recruitment Partners
        </p>
      </div>
      <div className="scrolling-text-container mt-8">
        <div className="scrolling-text flex">
          {OurClients.concat(OurClients).map((client, index) => (
            <div className="flex justify-center min-w-[120px] mx-2" key={index}>
              <img src={client.src} alt={`Client ${index + 1}`} />
            </div>
          ))}
        </div>
      </div>
    </div>
  );
}

export default OurHiringPartners;

Tailwind CSS with Minimal Custom CSS

javascript
import "./App.css"; // Assuming this is where you place your minimal custom CSS.

function App() {
  return <OurHiringPartners />;
}

export default App;

App.css (Custom CSS)

css
@keyframes scroll-left {
  0% {
    transform: translateX(0%);
  }
  100% {
    transform: translateX(-50%);
  }
}

.scrolling-text-container {
  overflow: hidden;
  white-space: nowrap;
  width: 100%;
  position: relative;
  background-color: #F8F8F8;
}

.scrolling-text {
  display: flex;
  white-space: nowrap;
  animation: scroll-left 30s linear infinite;
}

Explanation:

  • Scrolling Carousel: The scrolling-text-container wraps around the scrolling-text div, which animates horizontally using the scroll-left keyframe. This creates a continuous scroll effect.
  • Concatenation for Infinite Scroll: The OurClients.concat(OurClients) in the JSX duplicates the array, making the carousel feel infinite.
  • Minimal CSS: Only the necessary keyframes and overflow styling are added to make the carousel function smoothly, adhering to your preference for minimal CSS.

import React from "react";
import "./ourhiringpartner.css";

function OurHiringPartners() {
  const OurClients = [
    { src: "client1.svg" },
    { src: "client2.svg" },
    { src: "client3.svg" },
    { src: "client4.svg" },
    { src: "client5.svg" },
    { src: "client6.svg" },
    { src: "client7.svg" },
    { src: "client8.svg" },
  ];

  return (
    <div className="bg-[#F8F8F8] py-8">
      <div className="container mx-auto flex flex-col items-center">
        <h1 className="text-enroll_users font-semibold text-4xl sm:text-3xl text-center">
          Our Hiring Partners
        </h1>
        <p className="text-learnsmarter_text_p text-center font-medium text-sm w-[360px] mt-4">
          Top Placement Support and Training Institute in Chennai Our
          Recruitment Partners
        </p>
      </div>
      <div className="scrolling-text-container mt-8">
        <div className="scrolling-text flex">
          {OurClients.map((client, index) => (
            <div className="flex justify-center min-w-[120px] mx-2" key={index}>
              <img src={client.src} alt={`Client ${index + 1}`} />
            </div>
          ))}
          {OurClients.map((client, index) => (
            <div className="flex justify-center min-w-[120px] mx-2" key={index + OurClients.length}>
              <img src={client.src} alt={`Client ${index + 1}`} />
            </div>
          ))}
        </div>
      </div>
    </div>
  );
}

Let's address both issues:

  1. Confetti Issue: The confetti is being rendered within the Subscribe component, which limits its coverage to the component's dimensions. To make the confetti cover the entire window, we'll need to position it at the top level of the page.

  2. Popup Enhancements: We'll add a fade-in transition to the popup and include a close (x) button to dismiss it manually.

Here's the updated Subscribe component:

javascript
import React, { useState } from "react";
import Confetti from "react-confetti";

function Subscribe() {
  const [showConfetti, setShowConfetti] = useState(false);
  const [showPopup, setShowPopup] = useState(false);

  const handleSubscribe = () => {
    setShowConfetti(true);
    setShowPopup(true);
    setTimeout(() => {
      setShowConfetti(false);
    }, 3000); // Confetti duration
  };

  const handleClosePopup = () => {
    setShowPopup(false);
  };

  return (
    <div className="p-4 bg-[#F4F4F4] relative">
      {showConfetti && (
        <Confetti
          width={window.innerWidth}
          height={window.innerHeight}
          numberOfPieces={300}
          recycle={false}
        />
      )}

      {showPopup && (
        <div className="fixed inset-0 flex justify-center items-center bg-black bg-opacity-50 z-50">
          <div className="bg-white p-6 rounded-md shadow-lg text-center relative transition-all duration-300 transform scale-100">
            <button
              className="absolute top-2 right-2 text-gray-500 hover:text-gray-700"
              onClick={handleClosePopup}
            >
              &times;
            </button>
            <p className="text-enroll_users font-semibold text-lg">
               Thank you for subscribing!
            </p>
            <p className="text-learnsmarter_text_p text-sm mt-2">
              You've successfully subscribed to our newsletter.
            </p>
          </div>
        </div>
      )}

      <div className="container flex-col lp:max-w-full tb:max-w-full gap-3 lp:px-10 flex mx-auto sm:max-w-full sm:px-4">
        <div className="w-full flex flex-col items-center gap-4 pb-4 sm:gap-1 ">
          <div className="flex flex-col items-center">
            <h1 className="text-enroll_users font-semibold text-2xl sm:text-xl">
              Subscribe to Our Newsletter for
            </h1>
            <h1 className="text-enroll_users font-semibold text-2xl sm:text-xl">
              the Latest Course Updates!
            </h1>
          </div>
          <p className="text-learnsmarter_text_p font-medium text-sm w-[450px] text-center sm:w-96">
            Stay informed about our newest courses and exclusive offers.
            Subscribe now and receive 20% off on your first course enrollment!
          </p>
        </div>
        <div className="w-fit flex mr-auto ml-auto gap-3 flex-col justify-center">
          <div className="flex justify-between w-fit bg-subscribeFormBG px-3 py-2 rounded-full">

      </div>

  );
}

ChatGPT said:

To make sure the confetti comes from the top of the window and that both the confetti and popup appear simultaneously with the correct z-index, I'll update the code. I'll also add a smooth transition effect for the popup.

Here's the updated Subscribe component:

javascript
import React, { useState, useEffect } from "react";
import Confetti from "react-confetti";

function Subscribe() {
  const [showConfetti, setShowConfetti] = useState(false);
  const [showPopup, setShowPopup] = useState(false);
  const [popupVisible, setPopupVisible] = useState(false);

  const handleSubscribe = () => {
    setShowConfetti(true);
    setShowPopup(true);

    // Hide confetti after 3 seconds
    setTimeout(() => {
      setShowConfetti(false);
    }, 3000);
    
    // Show popup with transition
    setTimeout(() => {
      setPopupVisible(true);
    }, 100); // Slight delay for smoother transition

    // Automatically close popup after 5 seconds
    setTimeout(() => {
      setPopupVisible(false);
    }, 5000);
  };

  const handleClosePopup = () => {
    setPopupVisible(false);
  };

  return (
    <div className="p-4 bg-[#F4F4F4] relative">
      {showConfetti && (
        <Confetti
          width={window.innerWidth}
          height={window.innerHeight}
          numberOfPieces={300}
          recycle={false}
          className="fixed top-0 left-0 z-50"
        />
      )}

      {showPopup && (
        <div className="fixed inset-0 flex justify-center items-center bg-black bg-opacity-50 z-50">
          <div
            className={`bg-white p-6 rounded-md shadow-lg text-center relative transition-transform duration-500 ease-out transform ${
              popupVisible ? "scale-100 opacity-100" : "scale-75 opacity-0"
            }`}
          >
            <button
              className="absolute top-2 right-2 text-gray-500 hover:text-gray-700"
              onClick={handleClosePopup}
            >
              &times;
            </button>
            <p className="text-enroll_users font-semibold text-lg">
               Thank you for subscribing!
            </p>
            <p className="text-learnsmarter_text_p text-sm mt-2">
              You've successfully subscribed to our newsletter.
            </p>
          </div>
        </div>
      )}

      <div className="container flex-col lp:max-w-full tb:max-w-full gap-3 lp:px-10 flex mx-auto sm:max-w-full sm:px-4">
        <div className="w-full flex flex-col items-center gap-4 pb-4 sm:gap-1 ">
          <div className="flex flex-col items-center">
            <h1 className="text-enroll_users font-semibold text-2xl sm:text-xl">
              Subscribe to Our Newsletter for
            </h1>
            <h1 className="text-enroll_users font-semibold text-2xl sm:text-xl">
              the Latest Course Updates!
            </h1>
          </div>
          <p className="text-learnsmarter_text_p font-medium text-sm w-[450px] text-center sm:w-96">
            Stay informed about our newest courses and exclusive offers.
            Subscribe now and receive 20% off on your first course enrollment!
          </p>
        </div>
        <div className="w-fit flex mr-auto ml-auto gap-3 flex-col justify-center">
          <div className="flex justify-between w-fit bg-subscribeFormBG px-3 py-2 rounded-full">
            <div className="flex gap-2">
              <img className="w-5" src="mail-icon.svg" alt="Mail Icon" />
              <input
                className="bg-subscribeFormBG outline-none text-sm"
                type="text"
                placeholder="Enter your email"
              />
            </div>
            <button
              onClick={handleSubscribe}
              className="bg-enroll_users text-white font-medium text-sm flex items-center px-6 py-3 rounded-full"
            >
              Subscribe
            </button>
          </div>
          <p className="text-learnsmarter_text_p font-medium text-sm text-center flex gap-1 mt-2">
            We prioritize the protection of your data in our
            <span className="underline underline-offset-2 cursor-pointer">
              privacy policy.
            </span>
          </p>
        </div>
      </div>
    </div>
  );
}

export default Subscribe;

Explanation of Updates:

  1. Confetti Placement and Z-Index:

    • The confetti is positioned at the top of the window using className="fixed top-0 left-0 z-50" to ensure it appears above other elements and covers the entire window.

  2. Popup Transition:

    • The popup has a smooth scale and opacity transition using transition-transform and transform classes.
    • The popupVisible state controls the visibility and transition effect of the popup.

  3. Simultaneous Popup and Confetti:

    • Both the confetti and popup appear simultaneously when the user subscribes. The confetti will disappear after 3 seconds, while the popup stays for 5 seconds or until manually closed.

This approach should make the popup and confetti appear more naturally and polished with a smooth user experience.

ChatGPT said:

To ensure the confetti comes from the top of the window, we need to make sure the Confetti component is properly positioned. It should be placed outside of the Subscribe component's container to avoid any positioning issues and ensure it covers the entire viewport.

Here's the revised code:

javascript
import React, { useState } from "react";
import Confetti from "react-confetti";

function Subscribe() {
  const [showConfetti, setShowConfetti] = useState(false);
  const [showPopup, setShowPopup] = useState(false);
  const [popupVisible, setPopupVisible] = useState(false);

  const handleSubscribe = () => {
    setShowConfetti(true);
    setShowPopup(true);

    setTimeout(() => {
      setShowConfetti(false);
    }, 3000); // Confetti duration

    setTimeout(() => {
      setPopupVisible(true);
    }, 100); // Slight delay for smoother transition

    setTimeout(() => {
      setPopupVisible(false);
    }, 5000); // Popup duration
  };

  const handleClosePopup = () => {
    setPopupVisible(false);
  };

  return (
    <div className="relative p-4 bg-[#F4F4F4]">
      {showConfetti && (
        <Confetti
          width={window.innerWidth}
          height={window.innerHeight}
          numberOfPieces={300}
          recycle={false}
          style={{ position: 'fixed', top: 0, left: 0, zIndex: 50 }}
        />
      )}

      {showPopup && (
        <div className="fixed inset-0 flex justify-center items-center bg-black bg-opacity-50 z-50">
          <div
            className={`bg-white p-6 rounded-md shadow-lg text-center relative transition-transform duration-500 ease-out transform ${
              popupVisible ? "scale-100 opacity-100" : "scale-75 opacity-0"
            }`}
          >
            <button
              className="absolute top-2 right-2 text-gray-500 hover:text-gray-700"
              onClick={handleClosePopup}
            >
              &times;
            </button>
            <p className="text-enroll_users font-semibold text-lg">
               Thank you for subscribing!
            </p>
            <p className="text-learnsmarter_text_p text-sm mt-2">
              You've successfully subscribed to our newsletter.
            </p>
          </div>
        </div>
      )}

      <div className="container flex-col lp:max-w-full tb:max-w-full gap-3 lp:px-10 flex mx-auto sm:max-w-full sm:px-4">
        <div className="w-full flex flex-col items-center gap-4 pb-4 sm:gap-1 ">
          <div className="flex flex-col items-center">
            <h1 className="text-enroll_users font-semibold text-2xl sm:text-xl">
              Subscribe to Our Newsletter for
            </h1>
            <h1 className="text-enroll_users font-semibold text-2xl sm:text-xl">
              the Latest Course Updates!
            </h1>
          </div>
          <p className="text-learnsmarter_text_p font-medium text-sm w-[450px] text-center sm:w-96">
            Stay informed about our newest courses and exclusive offers.
            Subscribe now and receive 20% off on your first course enrollment!
          </p>
        </div>
        <div className="w-fit flex mr-auto ml-auto gap-3 flex-col justify-center">
          <div className="flex justify-between w-fit bg-subscribeFormBG px-3 py-2 rounded-full">
            <div className="flex gap-2">
              <img className="w-5" src="mail-icon.svg" alt="Mail Icon" />
              <input
                className="bg-subscribeFormBG outline-none text-sm"
                type="text"
                placeholder="Enter your email"
              />
            </div>
            <button
              onClick={handleSubscribe}
              className="bg-enroll_users text-white font-medium text-sm flex items-center px-6 py-3 rounded-full"
            >
              Subscribe
            </button>
          </div>
          <p className="text-learnsmarter_text_p font-medium text-sm text-center flex gap-1 mt-2">
            We prioritize the protection of your data in our
            <span className="underline underline-offset-2 cursor-pointer">
              privacy policy.
            </span>
          </p>
        </div>
      </div>
    </div>
  );

ChatGPT said:

The gray overlay that appears when the popup is shown is preventing interactions with the rest of the page. To allow interactions after the confetti animation is complete, you need to remove or hide the overlay after a certain time or when the popup is closed.

Here's the updated code that hides the overlay after the popup disappears:

javascript
import React, { useState } from "react";
import Confetti from "react-confetti";

function Subscribe() {
  const [showConfetti, setShowConfetti] = useState(false);
  const [showPopup, setShowPopup] = useState(false);
  const [popupVisible, setPopupVisible] = useState(false);

  const handleSubscribe = () => {
    setShowConfetti(true);
    setShowPopup(true);

    setTimeout(() => {
      setShowConfetti(false);
    }, 3000); // Confetti duration

    setTimeout(() => {
      setPopupVisible(true);
    }, 100); // Slight delay for smoother transition

    setTimeout(() => {
      setPopupVisible(false);
      setShowPopup(false); // Hide the popup after it disappears
    }, 5000); // Popup duration
  };

  const handleClosePopup = () => {
    setPopupVisible(false);
    setShowPopup(false); // Hide the popup when the close button is clicked
  };

  return (
    <div className="relative p-4 bg-[#F4F4F4]">
      {showConfetti && (
        <Confetti
          width={window.innerWidth}
          height={window.innerHeight}
          numberOfPieces={300}
          recycle={false}
          style={{ position: 'fixed', top: 0, left: 0, zIndex: 50 }}
        />
      )}

      {showPopup && (
        <div className="fixed inset-0 flex justify-center items-center bg-black bg-opacity-50 z-50">
          <div
            className={`bg-white p-6 rounded-md shadow-lg text-center relative transition-transform duration-500 ease-out transform ${
              popupVisible ? "scale-100 opacity-100" : "scale-75 opacity-0"
            }`}
          >
            <button
              className="absolute top-2 right-2 text-gray-500 hover:text-gray-700"
              onClick={handleClosePopup}
            >
              &times;
            </button>
            <p className="text-enroll_users font-semibold text-lg">
               Thank you for subscribing!
            </p>
            <p className="text-learnsmarter_text_p text-sm mt-2">
              You've successfully subscribed to our newsletter.
            </p>
          </div>
        </div>
      )}

      <div className="container flex-col lp:max-w-full tb:max-w-full gap-3 lp:px-10 flex mx-auto sm:max-w-full sm:px-4">
        <div className="w-full flex flex-col items-center gap-4 pb-4 sm:gap-1 ">
          <div className="flex flex-col items-center">
            <h1 className="text-enroll_users font-semibold text-2xl sm:text-xl">
              Subscribe to Our Newsletter for
            </h1>
            <h1 className="text-enroll_users font-semibold text-2xl sm:text-xl">
              the Latest Course Updates!
            </h1>
          </div>
          <p className="text-learnsmarter_text_p font-medium text-sm w-[450px] text-center sm:w-96">
            Stay informed about our newest courses and exclusive offers.
            Subscribe now and receive 20% off on your first course enrollment!
          </p>
        </div>
        <div className="w-fit flex mr-auto ml-auto gap-3 flex-col justify-center">
          <div className="flex justify-between w-fit bg-subscribeFormBG px-3 py-2 rounded-full">
            <div className="flex gap-2">
              <img className="w-5" src="mail-icon.svg" alt="Mail Icon" />
              <input

To ensure the popup and confetti close automatically after a certain period, you can use the existing timers but synchronize them so that both the popup and confetti disappear at the same time. Here's the adjusted code:

javascript
import React, { useState } from "react";
import Confetti from "react-confetti";

function Subscribe() {
  const [showConfetti, setShowConfetti] = useState(false);
  const [showPopup, setShowPopup] = useState(false);
  const [popupVisible, setPopupVisible] = useState(false);

  const handleSubscribe = () => {
    setShowConfetti(true);
    setShowPopup(true);

    setTimeout(() => {
      setShowConfetti(false);
    }, 3000); // Confetti duration

    setTimeout(() => {
      setPopupVisible(true);
    }, 100); // Slight delay for smoother transition

    setTimeout(() => {
      setPopupVisible(false);
      setShowPopup(false); // Hide the popup after it disappears
    }, 3000); // Popup and confetti auto-close at the same time
  };

  return (
    <div className="relative p-4 bg-[#F4F4F4]">
      {showConfetti && (
        <Confetti
          width={window.innerWidth}
          height={window.innerHeight}
          numberOfPieces={300}
          recycle={false}
          style={{ position: 'fixed', top: 0, left: 0, zIndex: 50 }}
        />
      )}

      {showPopup && (
        <div className="fixed inset-0 flex justify-center items-center bg-black bg-opacity-50 z-50">
          <div
            className={`bg-white p-6 rounded-md shadow-lg text-center relative transition-transform duration-500 ease-out transform ${
              popupVisible ? "scale-100 opacity-100" : "scale-75 opacity-0"
            }`}
          >
            <p className="text-enroll_users font-semibold text-lg">
               Thank you for subscribing!
            </p>
            <p className="text-learnsmarter_text_p text-sm mt-2">
              You've successfully subscribed to our newsletter.
            </p>
          </div>
        </div>
      )}

      <div className="container flex-col lp:max-w-full tb:max-w-full gap-3 lp:px-10 flex mx-auto sm:max-w-full sm:px-4">
        <div className="w-full flex flex-col items-center gap-4 pb-4 sm:gap-1 ">
          <div className="flex flex-col items-center">
            <h1 className="text-enroll_users font-semibold text-2xl sm:text-xl">
              Subscribe to Our Newsletter for
            </h1>
            <h1 className="text-enroll_users font-semibold text-2xl sm:text-xl">
              the Latest Course Updates!
            </h1>
          </div>
          <p className="text-learnsmarter_text_p font-medium text-sm w-[450px] text-center sm:w-96">
            Stay informed about our newest courses and exclusive offers.
            Subscribe now and receive 20% off on your first course enrollment!
          </p>
        </div>
        <div className="w-fit flex mr-auto ml-auto gap-3 flex-col justify-center">
          <div className="flex justify-between w-fit bg-subscribeFormBG px-3 py-2 rounded-full">
            <div className="flex gap-2">
              <img className="w-5" src="mail-icon.svg" alt="Mail Icon" />
              <input
                className="bg-subscribeFormBG outline-none text-sm"
                type="text"
                placeholder="Enter your email"
              />
            </div>
            <button
              onClick={handleSubscribe}
              className="bg-enroll_users text-white font-medium text-sm flex items-center px-6 py-3 rounded-full"
            >
              Subscribe
            </button>
          </div>
          <p className="text-learnsmarter_text_p font-medium text-sm text-center flex gap-1 mt-2">
            We prioritize the protection of your data in our
            <span className="underline underline-offset-2 cursor-pointer">
              privacy policy.
            </span>
          </p>
        </div>
      </div>
    </div>
  );
}

export default Subscribe;

Changes made:

  1. Confetti and Popup Synchronization: Both confetti and the popup are now set to close after 3 seconds. This duration can be adjusted based on your preferences.
  2. Remove Close Button: The close button (the "") was removed as requested. The popup will auto-close after the specified duration.

This setup should give a smooth user experience where the confetti and popup automatically disappear after the same amount of time.

ChatGPT said:

To make the popup closing transition smoother and avoid a quick disappearance, you can slightly adjust the transition timing and sequence. Heres how you can implement it:

  1. Delay the start of the popup closing transition: This gives it a more gradual feel.
  2. Adjust the timing function for a smoother ease-out effect: This ensures the popup scales down smoothly.

Here's the updated code:

javascript
import React, { useState } from "react";
import Confetti from "react-confetti";

function Subscribe() {
  const [showConfetti, setShowConfetti] = useState(false);
  const [showPopup, setShowPopup] = useState(false);
  const [popupVisible, setPopupVisible] = useState(false);

  const handleSubscribe = () => {
    setShowConfetti(true);
    setShowPopup(true);

    setTimeout(() => {
      setShowConfetti(false);
    }, 3000); // Confetti duration

    setTimeout(() => {
      setPopupVisible(true);
    }, 100); // Slight delay for smoother transition

    setTimeout(() => {
      setPopupVisible(false);
    }, 2500); // Start the closing transition earlier for a smooth effect

    setTimeout(() => {
      setShowPopup(false); // Hide the popup after the transition
    }, 3000); // Complete hiding after the full duration
  };

  return (
    <div className="relative p-4 bg-[#F4F4F4]">
      {showConfetti && (
        <Confetti
          width={window.innerWidth}
          height={window.innerHeight}
          numberOfPieces={300}
          recycle={false}
          style={{ position: 'fixed', top: 0, left: 0, zIndex: 50 }}
        />
      )}

      {showPopup && (
        <div className="fixed inset-0 flex justify-center items-center bg-black bg-opacity-50 z-50">
          <div
            className={`bg-white p-6 rounded-md shadow-lg text-center relative transition-transform duration-[700ms] ease-out transform ${
              popupVisible ? "scale-100 opacity-100" : "scale-75 opacity-0"
            }`}
          >
            <p className="text-enroll_users font-semibold text-lg">
               Thank you for subscribing!
            </p>
            <p className="text-learnsmarter_text_p text-sm mt-2">
              You've successfully subscribed to our newsletter.
            </p>
          </div>
        </div>
      )}

      <div className="container flex-col lp:max-w-full tb:max-w-full gap-3 lp:px-10 flex mx-auto sm:max-w-full sm:px-4">
        <div className="w-full flex flex-col items-center gap-4 pb-4 sm:gap-1 ">
          <div className="flex flex-col items-center">
            <h1 className="text-enroll_users font-semibold text-2xl sm:text-xl">
              Subscribe to Our Newsletter for
            </h1>
            <h1 className="text-enroll_users font-semibold text-2xl sm:text-xl">
              the Latest Course Updates!
            </h1>
          </div>
          <p className="text-learnsmarter_text_p font-medium text-sm w-[450px] text-center sm:w-96">
            Stay informed about our newest courses and exclusive offers.
            Subscribe now and receive 20% off on your first course enrollment!
          </p>
        </div>
        <div className="w-fit flex mr-auto ml-auto gap-3 flex-col justify-center">
          <div className="flex justify-between w-fit bg-subscribeFormBG px-3 py-2 rounded-full">
            <div className="flex gap-2">
              <img className="w-5" src="mail-icon.svg" alt="Mail Icon" />
              <input
                className="bg-subscribeFormBG outline-none text-sm"
                type="text"
                placeholder="Enter your email"
              />
            </div>
            <button
              onClick={handleSubscribe}
              className="bg-enroll_users text-white font-medium text-sm flex items-center px-6 py-3 rounded-full"
            >
              Subscribe
            </button>
          </div>
          <p className="text-learnsmarter_text_p font-medium text-sm text-center flex gap-1 mt-2">

            <span className="underline underline-offset-2 cursor-pointer">
              privacy policy.

      </div>
    </div>
  );
}

Changes Explained:

  • Duration Adjustment: The popup transition now uses a slightly longer duration (duration-[700ms]) to smooth out the scale effect.
  • Popup Closing: The popup starts closing 500ms before its fully hidden, ensuring it doesnt just disappear abruptly but gradually scales down.

This should give a more polished and smooth user experience.

When I submit need to store this data into google sheet ok. column name in google sheet : Email , DateTime
ChatGPT said:

To store the submitted email and the current date/time into a Google Sheet, you'll need to create a backend that can handle the request from your React app and then send the data to the Google Sheets API. Here's a basic outline of how you can achieve this:

Step 1: Set Up Google Sheets API

  1. Create a Google Sheet:

    • Create a new Google Sheet with the columns Email and DateTime.
    • Share the Google Sheet with an email address (e.g., a service account) that will have permission to edit the sheet.

  2. Enable Google Sheets API:

    • Go to the Google Cloud Console.
    • Create a new project (if you dont have one).
    • Enable the "Google Sheets API" for your project.
    • Create credentials (a service account key) and download the JSON file containing your credentials.

Step 2: Create a Backend to Handle Requests

Heres an example using Node.js and Express to create a simple API that handles the POST request from your React app:

  1. Install Required Packages:

    bash
    npm install express googleapis body-parser

  2. Create the Backend Code:

    Create a file named server.js:

    javascript
    const express = require('express');
const { google } = require('googleapis');
const bodyParser = require('body-parser');
const app = express();
const port = process.env.PORT || 5000;

// Middleware
app.use(bodyParser.json());

// Google Sheets setup
const auth = new google.auth.GoogleAuth({
  keyFile: 'path-to-your-credentials-file.json', // Path to your credentials file
  scopes: ['https://www.googleapis.com/auth/spreadsheets'],
});

To store the data (email and date/time) in a Google Sheet when the form is submitted, you can use Google Apps Script to handle the backend. Here's a step-by-step guide:

Step 1: Set Up Your Google Sheet

  1. Create a new Google Sheet with columns named Email and DateTime.
  2. Open the Script Editor by going to Extensions > Apps Script in your Google Sheet.

Step 2: Create the Google Apps Script

Replace the content of the script editor with the following code:

javascript
function doPost(e) {
  const sheet = SpreadsheetApp.getActiveSpreadsheet().getSheetByName('Sheet1'); // Adjust if your sheet name is different
  const data = JSON.parse(e.postData.contents);

  // Add a new row with email and current date-time
  sheet.appendRow([data.email, new Date()]);

  // Return a success response
  return ContentService
    .createTextOutput(JSON.stringify({ 'status': 'success' }))
    .setMimeType(ContentService.MimeType.JSON);
}
  1. Deploy the Script as a Web App:
    • Click on Deploy > New deployment.
    • In the Select type dropdown, choose Web app.
    • Set the Who has access to Anyone.
    • Click Deploy and note down the Web App URL.

Step 3: Update Your React Component to Submit Data

You need to update your handleSubscribe function in the React component to send the email to the Google Apps Script URL.

Here's how you can do that:

javascript
import React, { useState } from "react";
import Confetti from "react-confetti";

function Subscribe() {
  const [showConfetti, setShowConfetti] = useState(false);
  const [showPopup, setShowPopup] = useState(false);
  const [popupVisible, setPopupVisible] = useState(false);
  const [email, setEmail] = useState(""); // State to hold email input

  const handleSubscribe = async () => {
    // Send data to Google Sheets
    const response = await fetch('YOUR_WEB_APP_URL', {
      method: 'POST',
      body: JSON.stringify({ email: email }),
      headers: {
        'Content-Type': 'application/json',
      },
    });

    if (response.ok) {
      // Handle success (show confetti and popup)
      setShowConfetti(true);
      setShowPopup(true);

      setTimeout(() => {
        setShowConfetti(false);
      }, 3000); // Confetti duration

      setTimeout(() => {
        setPopupVisible(true);
      }, 100); // Slight delay for smoother transition

      setTimeout(() => {
        setPopupVisible(false);
        setShowPopup(false); // Hide the popup after it disappears
      }, 3000); // Popup and confetti auto-close at the same time
    } else {
      console.error('Error submitting data to Google Sheets');
    }
  };

  return (
    <div className="relative p-4 bg-[#F4F4F4]">
      {showConfetti && (
        <Confetti
          width={window.innerWidth}
          height={window.innerHeight}
          numberOfPieces={300}
          recycle={false}
          style={{ position: 'fixed', top: 0, left: 0, zIndex: 50 }}
        />
      )}

      {showPopup && (
        <div className="fixed inset-0 flex justify-center items-center bg-black bg-opacity-50 z-50">
          <div
            className={`bg-white p-6 rounded-md shadow-lg text-center relative transition-transform duration-500 ease-out transform ${
              popupVisible ? "scale-100 opacity-100" : "scale-75 opacity-0"
            }`}
          >
            <p className="text-enroll_users font-semibold text-lg">
               Thank you for subscribing!
            </p>
            <p className="text-learnsmarter_text_p text-sm mt-2">
              You've successfully subscribed to our newsletter.
            </p>
          </div>
        </div>
      )}

      <div className="container flex-col lp:max-w-full tb:max-w-full gap-3 lp:px-10 flex mx-auto sm:max-w-full sm:px-4">
        <div className="w-full flex flex-col items-center gap-4 pb-4 sm:gap-1 ">
          <div className="flex flex-col items-center">
            <h1 className="text-enroll_users font-semibold text-2xl sm:text-xl">
              Subscribe to Our Newsletter for
            </h1>
            <h1 className="text-enroll_users font-semibold text-2xl sm:text-xl">
              the Latest Course Updates!
            </h1>
          </div>
          <p className="text-learnsmarter_text_p font-medium text-sm w-[450px] text-center sm:w-96">
            Stay informed about our newest courses and exclusive offers.
            Subscribe now and receive 20% off on your first course enrollment!
          </p>
        </div>
        <div className="w-fit flex mr-auto ml-auto gap-3 flex-col justify-center">
          <div className="flex justify-between w-fit bg-subscribeFormBG px-3 py-2 rounded-full">
            <div className="flex gap-2">
              <img className="w-5" src="mail-icon.svg" alt="Mail Icon" />
              <input
                className="bg-subscribeFormBG outline-none text-sm"
                type="email"
                placeholder="Enter your email"
                value={email} // Bind input value to email state
                onChange={(e) => setEmail(e.target.value)} // Update email state on input change
              />
            </div>
            <button
              onClick={handleSubscribe}
              className="bg-enroll_users text-white font-medium text-sm flex items-center px-6 py-3 rounded-full"
            >
              Subscribe
            </button>
          </div>
          <p className="text-learnsmarter_text_p font-medium text-sm text-center flex gap-1 mt-2">
            We prioritize the protection of your data in our
            <span className="underline underline-offset-2 cursor-pointer">
              privacy policy.
            </span>
          </p>
        </div>
      </div>
    </div>
  );
}

export default Subscribe;

Replace YOUR_WEB_APP_URL with the actual URL of your deployed Google Apps Script. This approach ensures that the email and timestamp are stored in your Google Sheet each time someone subscribes.

import axios from "axios";
import React, { useState } from "react";
import Confetti from "react-confetti";

function Subscribe() {
  const [email, setEmail] = useState("");
  const [showConfetti, setShowConfetti] = useState(false);
  const [showPopup, setShowPopup] = useState(false);
  const [popupVisible, setPopupVisible] = useState(false);

  const handleSubscribe = async () => {
    const currentDateTime = new Date().toISOString(); // Get the current date and time

    try {
      await axios.post(
        "https://api.sheety.co/e8afbbce175c456cfded262f044131c7/subscribedStudents/page1",
        {
          page1: {
            Email: email,       // Use the email state variable
            DateTime: currentDateTime // Store the current date and time
          }
        }
      );

      setShowConfetti(true);
      setShowPopup(true);

        setShowConfetti(false);

        setPopupVisible(true);

        setPopupVisible(false);
        setShowPopup(false); // Hide the popup after it disappears
      }, 4000); // Popup and confetti auto-close at the same time

jsx
import React, { useState } from "react";
import Confetti from "react-confetti";

function Subscribe() {
  const [email, setEmail] = useState("");
  const [showConfetti, setShowConfetti] = useState(false);
  const [showPopup, setShowPopup] = useState(false);
  const [popupVisible, setPopupVisible] = useState(false);

  const handleSubscribe = async () => {
    const currentDateTime = new Date().toISOString(); // Get the current date and time

    let url = 'https://api.sheety.co/e8afbbce175c456cfded262f044131c7/subscribedStudents/page1';
    let body = {
      page1: {
        Email: email,
        DateTime: currentDateTime
      }
    };

    try {
      const response = await fetch(url, {
        method: 'POST',
        headers: {
          'Content-Type': 'application/json',
        },
        body: JSON.stringify(body)
      });

      if (!response.ok) {
        throw new Error(`HTTP error! status: ${response.status}`);
      }

      const json = await response.json();
      console.log("Subscription successful:", json.page1);

      setShowConfetti(true);
      setShowPopup(true);

      setTimeout(() => {
        setShowConfetti(false);
      }, 4000); // Confetti duration

      setTimeout(() => {
        setPopupVisible(true);
      }, 100); // Slight delay for smoother transition

      setTimeout(() => {
        setPopupVisible(false);
        setShowPopup(false); // Hide the popup after it disappears
      }, 4000); // Popup and confetti auto-close at the same time

    } catch (error) {
      console.error("Error during subscription:", error);
    }
  };

  return (
    <div className="relative p-4 bg-[#F4F4F4]">
      {showConfetti && (
        <Confetti
          width={window.innerWidth}
          height={window.innerHeight}
          numberOfPieces={300}

        <div className="w-full flex flex-col items-center gap-4 pb-4 sm:gap-1 ">
          <div className="flex flex-col items-center">
            <h1 className="text-enroll_users font-semibold text-2xl sm:text-xl">
              Subscribe to Our Newsletter for

              the Latest Course Updates!
            </h1>
          </div>

            Stay informed about our newest courses and exclusive offers.
            Subscribe now and receive 20% off on your first course enrollment!
          </p>
        </div>
        <div className="w-fit flex mr-auto ml-auto gap-3 flex-col justify-center">

Updated Axios Request with Error Handling

Heres how you can revise your Axios request to include proper headers and improved error handling:

jsx
import axios from "axios";
import React, { useState } from "react";
import Confetti from "react-confetti";

function Subscribe() {
  const [email, setEmail] = useState("");
  const [showConfetti, setShowConfetti] = useState(false);
  const [showPopup, setShowPopup] = useState(false);
  const [popupVisible, setPopupVisible] = useState(false);

  const handleSubscribe = async () => {
    const currentDateTime = new Date().toISOString(); // Get the current date and time

    const url = 'https://api.sheety.co/e8afbbce175c456cfded262f044131c7/subscribedStudents/page1';
    const body = {
      page1: {
        Email: email,
        DateTime: currentDateTime
      }
    };

    try {
      const response = await axios.post(url, body, {
        headers: {
          'Content-Type': 'application/json',
        }
      });
      
      console.log("Subscription successful:", response.data.page1);

      setShowConfetti(true);
      setShowPopup(true);

      setTimeout(() => {
        setShowConfetti(false);
      }, 4000); // Confetti duration

      setTimeout(() => {
        setPopupVisible(true);
      }, 100); // Slight delay for smoother transition

      setTimeout(() => {
        setPopupVisible(false);
        setShowPopup(false); // Hide the popup after it disappears
      }, 4000); // Popup and confetti auto-close at the same time

    } catch (error) {
      console.error("Error during subscription:", error.response ? error.response.data : error.message);
    }
  };

  return (
    <div className="relative p-4 bg-[#F4F4F4]">
      {showConfetti && (
        <Confetti
          width={window.innerWidth}
          height={window.innerHeight}
          numberOfPieces={300}
          recycle={false}
          style={{ position: "fixed", top: 0, left: 0, zIndex: 50 }}
        />
      )}

      {showPopup && (
        <div className="fixed inset-0 flex justify-center items-center bg-black bg-opacity-50 z-50">
          <div
            className={`bg-white p-6 rounded-md shadow-lg text-center relative transition-transform duration-500 ease-out transform ${
              popupVisible ? "scale-100 opacity-100" : "scale-75 opacity-0"
            }`}
          >
            <p className="text-enroll_users font-semibold text-lg">
               Thank you for subscribing!
            </p>
            <p className="text-learnsmarter_text_p text-sm mt-2">
              You've successfully subscribed to our newsletter.
            </p>
          </div>
        </div>
      )}

      <div className="container flex-col lp:max-w-full tb:max-w-full gap-3 lp:px-10 flex mx-auto sm:max-w-full sm:px-4">
        <div className="w-full flex flex-col items-center gap-4 pb-4 sm:gap-1 ">
          <div className="flex flex-col items-center">
            <h1 className="text-enroll_users font-semibold text-2xl sm:text-xl">
              Subscribe to Our Newsletter for
            </h1>
            <h1 className="text-enroll_users font-semibold text-2xl sm:text-xl">
              the Latest Course Updates!
            </h1>
          </div>
          <p className="text-learnsmarter_text_p font-medium text-sm w-[450px] text-center sm:w-96">
            Stay informed about our newest courses and exclusive offers.
            Subscribe now and receive 20% off on your first course enrollment!
          </p>
        </div>
        <div className="w-fit flex mr-auto ml-auto gap-3 flex-col justify-center">
          <div className="flex justify-between w-fit bg-subscribeFormBG px-3 py-2 rounded-full">
            <div className="flex gap-2">
              <img className="w-5" src="mail-icon.svg" alt="Mail Icon" />
              <input
                className="bg-subscribeFormBG outline-none text-sm"
                type="text"
                placeholder="Enter your email"
                value={email}
                onChange={(e) => setEmail(e.target.value)}
              />
            </div>
            <button
              onClick={handleSubscribe}
              className="bg-enroll_users text-white font-medium text-sm flex items-center px-6 py-3 rounded-full"
            >
              Subscribe
            </button>
          </div>
          <p className="text-learnsmarter_text_p font-medium text-sm text-center flex gap-1 mt-2">
            We prioritize the protection of your data in our
            <span className="underline underline-offset-2 cursor-pointer">
              privacy policy.
            </span>
          </p>
        </div>
      </div>
    </div>
  );
}

export default Subscribe;

  • Verify API Key: If your API requires an API key, make sure its included and correct.

If you continue to face issues, you might need to contact Sheety support or consult their documentation for more insights into the error.

The error message {"detail": "The caller does not have permission"} indicates that there is a permission issue with the API you're trying to access. Heres how you can troubleshoot and resolve this:

Troubleshooting Steps:

  1. Check API Permissions:

    • API Key: Ensure that the API key or token used in the request has the necessary permissions to perform the action. If you are using a service like Sheety, verify that the API key is correctly set up and has the required permissions.
    • Authentication: If the API requires authentication (like OAuth), ensure that you are authenticated correctly and that your token is valid.

  2. API Endpoint Configuration:

    • Verify that the endpoint https://api.sheety.co/e8afbbce175c456cfded262f044131c7/subscribedStudents/page1 is correct and accessible with the current permissions.

  3. Check API Documentation:

    • Review the API documentation for details on required permissions and authentication methods. Confirm that you are following the correct procedure for making requests.

  4. Update API Permissions:

    • If you have access to the API configuration, ensure that the endpoint has the correct permissions set up. You might need to update settings or request higher privileges.

  5. Check with API Provider:

    • Contact the API providers support team for assistance if you cannot resolve the issue with the available documentation.

Example of Updated Code with Authorization Header:

If your API requires an authorization header, you need to include it in your request. For example, if you need to use an API token:

jsx
import React, { useState } from "react";
import axios from "axios";
import Confetti from "react-confetti";

function Subscribe() {
  const [email, setEmail] = useState("");
  const [showConfetti, setShowConfetti] = useState(false);
  const [showPopup, setShowPopup] = useState(false);
  const [popupVisible, setPopupVisible] = useState(false);

  const handleSubscribe = async () => {
    const currentDateTime = new Date().toISOString(); // Get the current date and time

    const url = 'https://api.sheety.co/e8afbbce175c456cfded262f044131c7/subscribedStudents/page1';
    const body = {
      page1: {
        email: email,
        datetime: currentDateTime
      }
    };

    try {
      const response = await axios.post(url, body, {
        headers: {
          'Content-Type': 'application/json',
          'Authorization': `Bearer YOUR_API_TOKEN` // Replace with actual token if needed
        }
      });

      console.log("Subscription successful:", response.data.page1);

      setShowConfetti(true);
      setShowPopup(true);

      setTimeout(() => {
        setShowConfetti(false);
      }, 4000); // Confetti duration

      setTimeout(() => {
        setPopupVisible(true);
      }, 100); // Slight delay for smoother transition

      setTimeout(() => {
        setPopupVisible(false);
        setShowPopup(false); // Hide the popup after it disappears
      }, 4000); // Popup and confetti auto-close at the same time

      console.error("Error during subscription:", error.response ? error.response.data : error.message);
    }
  };

  return (
    <div className="relative p-4 bg-[#F4F4F4]">
      {showConfetti && (

        <div className="w-full flex flex-col items-center gap-4 pb-4 sm:gap-1 ">
